message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
public static void main(String[] args) {
    Scanner in = new Scanner(System.in);
    ArrayList<String> words = new ArrayList<String>();
    String fileName = ""; 
    File f;
    Scanner fileIn;
    System.out.println("Please enter a file name for encryption: ");
    fileName = "Test.txt"; 
    try {
        f = new File (fileName); 
        fileIn = new Scanner (f);
        while(fileIn.hasNext()) {
            words.add(fileIn.next());
        }
        PrintWriter fileOut = new PrintWriter ("Backwards.txt");
        for(String word : words) {
            for(char ch : word.toCharArray()) {
                if(Character.isLetter(ch)) {
                    ch += 1;
                }
                fileOut.write(ch);
            }
            fileOut.write(' ');
        }
        fileOut.close();
    } catch(FileNotFoundException e) {
        System.out.println("Couldn't find file");
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code reads words from a file and writes them to another file, incrementing each character by 1 in the ASCII table. The PrintWriter.write method is used to write each character to the output file. The 'for-each' loop is used to iterate over each character in the word. If the character is a letter, it is incremented by 1. The space character is written after each word.

Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
Question: Encrypt/Decrypt file. ASCII +1 for encryption/decryption: :I'm trying to read in a file of text, and "encrypt"/convert each letter to +1 from the ASCII table (I also want to "decrypt" so -1 for that). So "a" will become "b", "b" to "c" and so forth. I only need to convert alphabetic letters (Ignore everything else, print them as is). I'm having troubles with this part of the code:        for(int i = 0; i <= words.size(); i++)        {                            for(int j = 0; j <= words.get(i).length(); j++)            {                char ch = ' ';                ch = words.get(i).charAt(j);                ch += 1;                                    morewords.add(ch);            }                          fileOut.print(morewords.get(i)  + " ");        }  I've figured out how to +1 the char, but I'm not sure how to add that back in to an array or print it out correctly (Since "morewords.add(ch)" is only going to add the char, instead of converting all the chars an adding a string). The "words.get(i).length()" takes the entire length of the array "words", when I just want the length of the string @ position "i" in the array, so it throws an error since the length of the array is longer than the string word. I've been stuck on this for hours and I cannot figure it out. I'm thinking maybe I shouldn't read them in as strings and should have read them in as chars and this might have all been simpler? public static void main(String[] args) {        Scanner in = new Scanner(System.in);        ArrayList<String> words = new ArrayList<String>();        ArrayList<Character> morewords = new ArrayList<Character>();        String fileName = ""; //Replace Test with this        File f;        Scanner fileIn;        System.out.println("Please enter a file name for encryption: ");        //fileName = in.nextLine();        fileName = "Test.txt";        try        {            //Build the file and attach a scanner to it            f = new File (fileName);             fileIn = new Scanner (f);                        System.out.println(f.exists()); //For errors            int counting = 0;            //Reads in indvidual strings.             for(counting =0; fileIn.hasNext(); counting++)            {                                words.add(fileIn.next());                System.out.println(words);            }                        PrintWriter fileOut = new PrintWriter ("Backwards.txt");            for(int i = 0; i <= words.size(); i++)            {                                for(int j = 0; j <= words.get(i).length(); j++)                {                    char ch = ' ';                    ch = words.get(i).charAt(j);                    ch += 1;                                        morewords.add(ch);                }                              fileOut.print(morewords.get(i)  + " ");            }                        fileOut.close();                    }        catch(FileNotFoundException e)        {            System.out.println("Couldn't find file");        }    }  
Please using this api: PrintWriter.write.
